title: ICT admin intensifies drainage efforts amid Monsoon rains
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 29 (APP): The Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) Administration is on high alert, taking measures to prevent flooding and ensure smooth traffic flow, as the heavy rain showers hit the Federal Capital.
According to the spokesman of ICT administration, heavy rains have started pouring down on the city, prompting a swift response from the administration.
Assistant Commissioners and Magistrates are actively present in the field, closely monitoring the situation.
The district administration teams are visiting various low-lying areas to assess the impact and take necessary actions to prevent waterlogging.
A key focus is on the status of the cityâ€™s drains, including those in areas H-8 and G-7.
On the occasion, Deputy Commissioner Islamabad, Irfan Nawaz Memon emphasized the importance of effective drainage to prevent flooding.
He said that ACs and magistrates are working on the ground to ensure that the drainage systems function properly. And efforts were underway to manage the monsoon rains and minimize disruption.
Irfan Nawaz assured residents that all measures were being taken to maintain effective drainage. Traffic police were also on duty to ensure smooth traffic flow on all major highways. The district commissioner highlighted the cooperation between various departments to tackle the challenges posed by the heavy rains.
Meanwhile, the citizens were advised to lodge a complain regarding rainwater on the district administration number
051-9108084.
This coordinated effort by the authorities aimed to minimize the impact of the monsoon rains and keep the city running smoothly despite the challenging weather conditions.
